00001 #include <TCPSocket.h>
00002 
00003 #include <cstring>
00004 #include <iostream>
00005 
00006 using namespace NET;
00007 
00008 int main()
00009 {
00010     static char send_msg[] = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog";
00011     static char recv_msg[sizeof(send_msg)];
00012     static size_t len = sizeof(send_msg);
00013 
00014     try {
00015 
00016     // Test peer status on a TCP socket
00017     TCPSocket server_socket;
00018     TCPSocket client_socket;
00019     server_socket.bind( "127.0.0.1", 47777);
00020     server_socket.listen();
00021     if( server_socket.peerDisconnected()) return 1;
00022 
00023     client_socket.connect( "127.0.0.1", 47777);
00024 
00025     // Test socket handle
00026     TCPSocket::Handle tmp_handle = server_socket.accept();
00027     TCPSocket::Handle handle;
00028     TCPSocket::Handle& ref_handle = handle;
00029     handle = ref_handle;
00030     if(handle) return 1;
00031     if(!tmp_handle) return 1;
00032     handle = tmp_handle;
00033     if(!handle) return 1;
00034     if(tmp_handle) return 1;
00035     TCPSocket session_socket(handle);
00036     if(handle) return 1;
00037     if( session_socket.peerDisconnected()) return 1;
00038 
00039     session_socket.send( send_msg, len);
00040     if( client_socket.receive( recv_msg, len) != len) return 1;
00041     if( std::memcmp( send_msg, recv_msg, len) < 0) return 1;
00042 
00043     client_socket.disconnect();
00044     session_socket.send( send_msg, len);
00045     if( !session_socket.peerDisconnected()) return 1;
00046 
00047     // no errors in this testcase
00048     } catch( const SocketException& e)
00049     {
00050         std::cerr << e.what() << std::endl;
00051         std::cerr << e.errorCode() << std::endl;
00052         return 1;
00053     }
00054 }
